alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Le Flore; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 3:43PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Haskell, southeastern Sequoyah and northern Le Flore Counties through 430 PM CDT... At 343 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 4 miles southwest of Bokoshe, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Muldrow... Spiro... Panama... Bokoshe... Gans... Cowlington... Scullyville... Cottonwood... Milton... Braden... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 313 and 320. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for west central Arkansas...and southeastern and east central Oklahoma.
